news.title: Wikipedia
news.line1: An incomplete sphere made of large, white
news.line2: jigsaw puzzle pieces. Each puzzle piece contains
news.line3: one glyph from a different writing system, with
news.line5: Wikipedia is a multilingual free online
news.line6: encyclopedia written and maintained by a community
news.line7: of volunteers through open collaboration and a
news.line8: wiki-based editing system. Its editors are known
news.line9: as Wikipedians. Wikipedia is the largest and most-
news.line10: read reference work in history.[3] It is consistently
news.line11: one of the 10 most popular websites ranked by
news.line12: Similarweb and formerly Alexa; as of 2022, Wikipedia
news.line13: was ranked the 7th most popular site.[3][4] It is hosted
news.line14: by the Wikimedia Foundation, an American non-profit
